8 using System;
9 using System.Collections.Generic;

11 namespace ColorShapeLinks.Common
12 {
14  public class Board
15  {
29  public Piece? this[int row, int col]
30  {
31  get
32  {
33  // If client requested an invalid position, this is a bug in
34  // client code, so let's throw an exception
35  if (row < 0 || row >= rows || col < 0 || col >= cols)
36  {
37  throw new IndexOutOfRangeException(
38  $"Position {new Pos(row, col)} is out of bounds. " +
39  $"Board dimensions are {new Pos(rows, cols)}.");
40  }
41 
42  // Return piece
43  return board[col, row];
44  }
45  }
46 
49  public PColor Turn { get; private set; }
50 
52  public readonly int rows;
53 
55  public readonly int cols;
56 
58  public readonly int piecesInSequence;
59 
61  public readonly int roundPieces;
62 
64  public readonly int squarePieces;
65 
69  public readonly IEnumerable<IEnumerable<Pos>> winCorridors;
70 
71  // Internal struct for representing the pair
72  // (piece check function, player associated with piece)
73  private struct PieceFuncPlayer
74  {
75  // Function that checks if a piece belong to a player
76  public readonly Func<Piece, bool> checkPieceFunc;
77  // The player to be associated with a piece
78  public readonly PColor player;
79  // Create an new pair (piece check function, associated player)
80  public PieceFuncPlayer(
81  Func<Piece, bool> checkPieceFunc, PColor player)
82  {
83  this.checkPieceFunc = checkPieceFunc;
84  this.player = player;
85  }
86  }
87 
88  // Array of pairs (piece check function, player associated with piece)
89  private readonly PieceFuncPlayer[] pieceFuncsPlayers;
90 
91  // How many pieces left?
92  private int PiecesLeft
93  {
94  get
95  {
96  int total = 0;
97  IEnumerable<int> counts = numberOfPieces.Values;
98  foreach (int count in counts) total += count;
99  return total;
100  }
101  }
102 
103  // Internal representation of the game board
104  private Piece?[,] board;
105 
106  // Sequence of moves (for undo purposes)
107  private Stack<Pos> moveSequence;
108 
109  // Number of pieces
110  private IDictionary<Piece, int> numberOfPieces;
111 
112  // Number of moves performed so far
113  private int numMoves;
114 
129  public Board(int rows = 6, int cols = 7, int piecesInSequence = 4,
130  int roundPieces = 10, int squarePieces = 11)
131  {
132  // Aux. variables for determining win corridors
133  List<Pos> aCorridor;
134  List<IEnumerable<Pos>> corridors;
135 
136  // Is it possible to win?
137  if (rows < piecesInSequence && cols < piecesInSequence)
138  {
139  throw new InvalidOperationException(
140  "Invalid parameters, since it is not possible to win");
141  }
142 
143  // Keep number of rows
144  this.rows = rows;
145 
146  // Keep number of columns
147  this.cols = cols;
148 
149  // Keep number of pieces in sequence to find winner
150  this.piecesInSequence = piecesInSequence;
151 
152  // Keep initial number of round pieces
153  this.roundPieces = roundPieces;
154 
155  // Keep initial number of square pieces
156  this.squarePieces = squarePieces;
157 
158  // Number of moves initially zero
159  numMoves = 0;
160 
161  // Initially, it's player 1 turn
162  Turn = PColor.White;
163 
164  // Instantiate the array representing the board
165  board = new Piece?[cols, rows];
166 
167  // Initialize the array of functions for checking pieces
168  pieceFuncsPlayers = new PieceFuncPlayer[]
169  {
170  // Shape must come before color
171  new PieceFuncPlayer(p => p.shape == PShape.Round, PColor.White),
172  new PieceFuncPlayer(p => p.shape == PShape.Square, PColor.Red),
173  new PieceFuncPlayer(p => p.color == PColor.White, PColor.White),
174  new PieceFuncPlayer(p => p.color == PColor.Red, PColor.Red)
175  };
176 
177  // Create and populate array of win corridors
178  corridors = new List<IEnumerable<Pos>>();
179  aCorridor = new List<Pos>(Math.Max(rows, cols));
180 
181  // Initialize move sequence with initial capacity for all possible
182  // moves
183  moveSequence = new Stack<Pos>(rows * cols);
184 
185  // Setup initial number of pieces
186  numberOfPieces = new Dictionary<Piece, int>()
187  {
188  { new Piece(PColor.White, PShape.Round), roundPieces },
189  { new Piece(PColor.White, PShape.Square), squarePieces },
190  { new Piece(PColor.Red, PShape.Round), roundPieces },
191  { new Piece(PColor.Red, PShape.Square), squarePieces },
192  };
193 
194  //
195  // Horizontal corridors
196  //
197  if (cols >= piecesInSequence)
198  {
199  for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++)
200  {
201  for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++)
202  {
203  aCorridor.Add(new Pos(r, c));
204  }
205  corridors.Add(aCorridor.ToArray());
206  aCorridor.Clear();
207  }
208  }
209 
210  //
211  // Vertical corridors
212  //
213  if (rows >= piecesInSequence)
214  {
215  for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++)
216  {
217  for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++)
218  {
219  aCorridor.Add(new Pos(r, c));
220  }
221  corridors.Add(aCorridor.ToArray());
222  aCorridor.Clear();
223  }
224  }
225 
226  //
227  // Diagonal corridors /
228  //
229  // Down
230  for (int row = rows - 1; row >= 0; row--)
231  {
232  int r = row;
233  int c = 0;
234  while (r < rows && c < cols)
235  {
236  aCorridor.Add(new Pos(r, c));
237  r++;
238  c++;
239  }
240  if (aCorridor.Count >= this.piecesInSequence)
241  corridors.Add(aCorridor.ToArray());
242  aCorridor.Clear();
243  }
244  // Right
245  for (int col = 1; col < cols; col++)
246  {
247  int r = 0;
248  int c = col;
249  while (r < rows && c < cols)
250  {
251  aCorridor.Add(new Pos(r, c));
252  r++;
253  c++;
254  }
255  if (aCorridor.Count >= this.piecesInSequence)
256  corridors.Add(aCorridor.ToArray());
257  aCorridor.Clear();
258  }
259 
260  //
261  // Diagonal corridors \
262  //
263  // Down
264  for (int row = rows - 1; row >= 0; row--)
265  {
266  int r = row;
267  int c = cols - 1;
268  while (r < rows && c >= 0)
269  {
270  aCorridor.Add(new Pos(r, c));
271  r++;
272  c--;
273  }
274  if (aCorridor.Count >= this.piecesInSequence)
275  corridors.Add(aCorridor.ToArray());
276  aCorridor.Clear();
277  }
278  // Left
279  for (int col = cols - 2; col >= 0; col--)
280  {
281  int r = 0;
282  int c = col;
283  while (r < rows && c >= 0)
284  {
285  aCorridor.Add(new Pos(r, c));
286  r++;
287  c--;
288  }
289  if (aCorridor.Count >= this.piecesInSequence)
290  corridors.Add(aCorridor.ToArray());
291  aCorridor.Clear();
292  }
293 
294  // Keep the final list of win corridors
295  winCorridors = corridors.ToArray();
296  }
297 
315  public int DoMove(PShape shape, int col)
316  {
317  // The row were to place the piece, initially assumed to be the top
318  // row
319  int row = rows - 1;
320 
321  // The color of the piece to place, depends on who's playing
322  PColor color = Turn;
323 
324  // The piece to place
325  Piece piece = new Piece(color, shape);
326 
327  // If the column is not a valid column, there is a client code bug,
328  // so let's throw an exception
329  if (col < 0 || col >= cols)
330  {
331  throw new InvalidOperationException(
332  $"Invalid board column: {col}");
333  }
334 
335  // If we already found a winner, there is a client code bug, so
336  // let's throw an exception
337  if (CheckWinner() != Winner.None)
338  {
339  throw new InvalidOperationException(
340  "Game is over, unable to make further moves.");
341  }
342 
343  // If there are no more pieces of the specified kind, there is a
344  // client bug, so let's throw an exception
345  if (numberOfPieces[piece] == 0)
346  {
347  throw new InvalidOperationException(
348  $"No more {piece} pieces available");
349  }
350 
351  // If column is already full, return negative value, indicating the
352  // move is invalid
353  if (board[col, row].HasValue) return -1;
354 
355  //
356  // If we get here, move is valid, so let's do it
357  //
358 
359  // Find row where to place the piece
360  for (int r = row - 1; r >= 0 && !board[col, r].HasValue; r--)
361  {
362  row = r;
363  }
364 
365  // Place the piece
366  board[col, row] = piece;
367 
368  // Decrease the piece count
369  numberOfPieces[piece]--;
370 
371  // Remember the move
372  moveSequence.Push(new Pos(row, col));
373 
374  // Increment number of moves
375  numMoves++;
376 
377  // Update turn
378  Turn = Turn.Other();
379 
380  // Return true, indicating the move was successful
381  return row;
382  }
383 
386  public Move UndoMove()
387  {
388  Pos pos;
389  Piece piece;
390 
391  // If no undo is possible, there is a bug in client code, so let's
392  // throw an exception
393  if (moveSequence.Count == 0)
394  {
395  throw new InvalidOperationException("No moves to undo.");
396  }
397 
398  // Get last move position
399  pos = moveSequence.Pop();
400 
401  // If there is no piece in last moves' position, there is a bug
402  // somewhere
403  if (!board[pos.col, pos.row].HasValue)
404  {
405  throw new InvalidOperationException(
406  $"No piece in undo position {pos}. Board in invalid state.");
407  }
408 
409  // Get the piece from the board
410  piece = board[pos.col, pos.row].Value;
411  board[pos.col, pos.row] = null;
412 
413  // Decrement number of moves
414  numMoves--;
415 
416  // Swap turns
417  Turn = Turn.Other();
418 
419  // Increase piece count
420  numberOfPieces[piece]++;
421 
422  // Return move that was undone
423  return new Move(pos.row, pos.col, piece);
424  }
425 
436  public Winner CheckWinner(Pos[] solution = null)
437  {
438  // If an array for placing the solution was given, make sure it has
439  // the required capacity
440  if (solution != null && solution.Length < piecesInSequence)
441  throw new InvalidOperationException(
442  "Array for placing solution " +
443  $"must have at least length {piecesInSequence}");
444 
445  // Is the board full? Then we have a draw
446  if (numMoves == cols * rows || PiecesLeft == 0) return Winner.Draw;
447 
448  // Check for all different pieces
449  foreach (PieceFuncPlayer funcPlayer in pieceFuncsPlayers)
450  {
451  // Check all possible corridors
452  foreach (IEnumerable<Pos> corridor in winCorridors)
453  {
454  // Reset count for this corridor
455  int count = 0;
456 
457  // Check positions in this corridor
458  foreach (Pos p in corridor)
459  {
460  // Update solution array
461  if (solution != null) solution[count] = p;
462 
463  // Does position contain the appropriate piece?
464  if (board[p.col, p.row].HasValue &&
465  funcPlayer.checkPieceFunc(board[p.col, p.row].Value))
466  // Yes it does, increment counter
467  count++;
468  else
469  // No it doesn't, reset count
470  count = 0;
471  // Did we find enough pieces in a row?
472  if (count == piecesInSequence)
473  // If so, return winner
474  return funcPlayer.player == PColor.White
475  ? Winner.White
476  : Winner.Red;
477  }
478  }
479  }
480 
481  // No winner found
482  return Winner.None;
483  }
484 
490  public Board Copy()
491  {
492  // The move sequence in the new board
493  Pos[] newBoardMoveSequence;
494 
495  // Create a shallow copy of the board
496  Board newBoard = (Board)MemberwiseClone();
497 
498  // Deep-clone the board array
499  newBoard.board = board.Clone() as Piece?[,];
500 
501  // Deep-clone the move sequence
502  newBoardMoveSequence = moveSequence.ToArray();
503  Array.Reverse(newBoardMoveSequence);
504  newBoard.moveSequence = new Stack<Pos>(newBoardMoveSequence);
505 
506  // Deep-clone the number of pieces
507  newBoard.numberOfPieces = new Dictionary<Piece, int>(numberOfPieces);
508 
509  // Return a deep copy of the board
510  return newBoard;
511  }
512 
521  public int PieceCount(PColor color, PShape shape) =>
522  numberOfPieces[new Piece(color, shape)];
523 
529  public bool IsColumnFull(int col) => board[col, rows - 1].HasValue;
530  }
